Congatious_event_source_article: UPDATE 1-Over 50 killed by army in central Congo clashes;DR Congo: MONUSCO condemns persistent violence in Kasai provinces;MONUSCO criticizes 'indiscriminate use of force' in DRC;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;At least 90 killed in clashes between police and militias in Congo;MONUSCO strongly condemns the persistent violence in the Kasai Provinces; Particularly, since 9 February 2017, there have been ongoing clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and Congolese Security Forces within the area of Tshimbulu (160 Kilometers South East of Kananga) with unconfirmed reports of between 30 to 50 deaths resulting from these clashes;Zeid calls for immediate halt to DRC killings; The Office (UNJHRO) received reports that some 50 people were killed by troops between 6 and 8 February, and a further 101 people were reported killed in confrontations with soldiers between 9 and 13 February;Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo

Congatious_event_source_article: Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
dyad_name: Government of DR Congo (Zaire) - Kamuina Nsapu
source_article: "Reuters News,2017-02-10,UPDATE 1-Over 50 killed by army in central Congo clashes";"PANAPRESS - Pan African News Agency,2017-02-11,DR Congo: MONUSCO condemns persistent violence in Kasai provinces";"Deutsche Welle,2017-02-11,MONUSCO criticizes 'indiscriminate use of force' in DRC";"ForeignAffairs.co.nz,2017-02-11,DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces";"India Blooms News Service,2017-02-12,DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces";"dpa International Service in English,2017-02-12,At least 90 killed in clashes between police and militias in Congo";"African Press Organization,2017-02-13,MONUSCO strongly condemns the persistent violence in the Kasai Provinces; Particularly, since 9 February 2017, there have been ongoing clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and Congolese Security Forces within the area of Tshimbulu (160 Kilometers South East of Kananga) with unconfirmed reports of between 30 to 50 deaths resulting from these clashes";"African Press Organization,2017-02-20,Zeid calls for immediate halt to DRC killings; The Office (UNJHRO) received reports that some 50 people were killed by troops between 6 and 8 February, and a further 101 people were reported killed in confrontations with soldiers between 9 and 13 February";"S/2017/206,2017-03-10,Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo "
source_office: Reuters News;PANAPRESS - Pan African News Agency;Deutsche Welle;ForeignAffairs.co.nz;India Blooms News Service;dpa International Service in English;African Press Organization;African Press Organization;S/2017/206
source_headline: UPDATE 1-Over 50 killed by army in central Congo clashes;DR Congo: MONUSCO condemns persistent violence in Kasai provinces;MONUSCO criticizes 'indiscriminate use of force' in DRC;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;At least 90 killed in clashes between police and militias in Congo;MONUSCO strongly condemns the persistent violence in the Kasai Provinces; Particularly, since 9 February 2017, there have been ongoing clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and Congolese Security Forces within the area of Tshimbulu (160 Kilometers South East of Kananga) with unconfirmed reports of between 30 to 50 deaths resulting from these clashes;Zeid calls for immediate halt to DRC killings; The Office (UNJHRO) received reports that some 50 people were killed by troops between 6 and 8 February, and a further 101 people were reported killed in confrontations with soldiers between 9 and 13 February;Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
source_original: Opposition politician, activist, and MONUSCO's spokesman
where_description: town of Tshimbulu in Kasai-Central province

source_headline: UPDATE 1-Over 50 killed by army in central Congo clashes;DR Congo: MONUSCO condemns persistent violence in Kasai provinces;MONUSCO criticizes 'indiscriminate use of force' in DRC;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces;At least 90 killed in clashes between police and militias in Congo;MONUSCO strongly condemns the persistent violence in the Kasai Provinces; Particularly, since 9 February 2017, there have been ongoing clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and Congolese Security Forces within the area of Tshimbulu (160 Kilometers South East of Kananga) with unconfirmed reports of between 30 to 50 deaths resulting from these clashes;Zeid calls for immediate halt to DRC killings; The Office (UNJHRO) received reports that some 50 people were killed by troops between 6 and 8 February, and a further 101 people were reported killed in confrontations with soldiers between 9 and 13 February;Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo

source_article: "Reuters News,2017-02-10,UPDATE 1-Over 50 killed by army in central Congo clashes";"PANAPRESS - Pan African News Agency,2017-02-11,DR Congo: MONUSCO condemns persistent violence in Kasai provinces";"Deutsche Welle,2017-02-11,MONUSCO criticizes 'indiscriminate use of force' in DRC";"ForeignAffairs.co.nz,2017-02-11,DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces";"India Blooms News Service,2017-02-12,DR Congo: UN mission strongly condemns persistent violence in Kasai Provinces";"dpa International Service in English,2017-02-12,At least 90 killed in clashes between police and militias in Congo";"African Press Organization,2017-02-13,MONUSCO strongly condemns the persistent violence in the Kasai Provinces; Particularly, since 9 February 2017, there have been ongoing clashes between Kamuina Nsapu militia and Congolese Security Forces within the area of Tshimbulu (160 Kilometers South East of Kananga) with unconfirmed reports of between 30 to 50 deaths resulting from these clashes";"African Press Organization,2017-02-20,Zeid calls for immediate halt to DRC killings; The Office (UNJHRO) received reports that some 50 people were killed by troops between 6 and 8 February, and a further 101 people were reported killed in confrontations with soldiers between 9 and 13 February";"S/2017/206,2017-03-10,Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo "

source_article: "The Sun,2017-03-26,Cops die in atrocity";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"Canberra Times,2017-03-27,Militia kill 40 police in ambush";"Agence France Presse,2017-03-27,DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers";"African Press Organization,2017-03-28,Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-26,RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-27,Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police)";"OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï,2018-07-03,Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï"
source_office: The Sun;All Africa;All Africa;Canberra Times;Agence France Presse;African Press Organization;Radio Okapi;Radio Okapi;OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï
source_headline: Cops die in atrocity;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Militia kill 40 police in ambush;DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers;Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga;RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu;Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police);Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï
source_original:
Local Official; Police spokesman 
MONUSCO reported
where_description:
from Tshikapa to Kananga.
near the village of Kamuesha on the Tshikapa-Kananga road

source_article: "The Sun,2017-03-26,Cops die in atrocity";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"Canberra Times,2017-03-27,Militia kill 40 police in ambush";"Agence France Presse,2017-03-27,DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers";"African Press Organization,2017-03-28,Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-26,RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-27,Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police)";"OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï,2018-07-03,Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï"

source_headline: Cops die in atrocity;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Militia kill 40 police in ambush;DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers;Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga;RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu;Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police);Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï

source_article: "The Sun,2017-03-26,Cops die in atrocity";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"All Africa,2017-03-26,Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo";"Canberra Times,2017-03-27,Militia kill 40 police in ambush";"Agence France Presse,2017-03-27,DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers";"African Press Organization,2017-03-28,Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-26,RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu";"Radio Okapi,2017-03-27,Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police)";"OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï,2018-07-03,Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï"
source_office: The Sun;All Africa;All Africa;Canberra Times;Agence France Presse;African Press Organization;Radio Okapi;Radio Okapi;OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï
source_headline: Cops die in atrocity;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Militia kill 40 police in ambush;DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers;Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga;RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu;Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police);Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï
source_original:
Local Official; Police spokesman 
MONUSCO reported
where_description:
from Tshikapa to Kananga.
near the village of Kamuesha on the Tshikapa-Kananga road

source_office: The Sun;All Africa;All Africa;Canberra Times;Agence France Presse;African Press Organization;Radio Okapi;Radio Okapi;OHCHR Team of international experts on the situation in Kasaï
source_headline: Cops die in atrocity;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Scores of Policemen Killed in Democratic Republic of Congo;Militia kill 40 police in ambush;DR Congo police accuse rebels of killing 39 officers;Joint communiqué of the African Union, the United Nations, the European Union and the International Organization of La Francophonie on the situation in the Kasaï provinces, Democratic Republic of the Congo; They express deep concern over the grave situation in the Kasaï provinces, as illustrated by reports that, between 23 and 24 March, about 40 members of the Congolese National Police were killed, during an ambush by the Kamuina Nsapu militia on the road between Tshikapa and Kananga;RDC: 42 policiers tués par des présumés miliciens Kamuina Nsapu;Kasai: 39 policemen killed in ambush at Kamuesha (Police);Rapport détaillé de l’Equipe d’experts internationaux sur la situation au Kasaï
source_original:
Local Official; Police spokesman 
MONUSCO reported
where_description:
from Tshikapa to Kananga.
near the village of Kamuesha on the Tshikapa-Kananga road

Congatious_event_source_article: "depeche.cd,2017-04-18,La Cité de Kamako à la frontière avec l’Angola en territoire de Tshikapa dans la nouvelle province du Kasaï est depuis quelques jours, devenue le bastion des hommes se présentant comme des miliciens du chef Kamuina Nsapu. Ceux-ci se livrent à des actes de barbarie attristant des nombreuses familles."
